DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of lidocaine in antiarrhythmic dosage on postoperative cognitive dysfunction in supratentorial craniotomy.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Lidocaine in Antiarrhythmic Dosage on Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction in Supratentorial Craniotomy Dysfunction in Supratentorial Craniotomy
DOC.criteria: 1860 years old, ASA physical status I or II, BMI<30 Scheduled for elective supratentorial craniotomy MMSE<24 before operation Cooperative and given informed consent in person History of mental or psychiatric disorders Contraindicated to internal jugular venous catheterization Pregnant or lactating female History of systemic malignant tumor or diabetes Previously treated with this protocol or participated in another study within previous 30 days Suspected history of allergic reaction or intolerance to amides or other anesthetic agents in this study History of alcohol abuse and/or drug abuse within previous one year History or a family history of malignant hyperthermia
